title: Web UI: label LC point details as Floquet Multipliers
description: In limit-cycle branch point details, rename the eigenvalue label to 'Floquet Multipliers'. Add tests if appropriate.
close_reason: Floquet multipliers label updated for LC branch point details with tests.

title: Fix inspector selection and expose system editor
description: Make object row clicks focus inspector selection, add System Settings entry, and normalize stored nodes for missing render fields.
close_reason: Updated Objects tree selection behavior, added System Settings button, normalized node defaults; tests: npm run test:unit.

title: Move System Settings to separate modal editor; remove Inspector tabs
description: Move System Settings into its own modal editor and eliminate tabbed UI in the Inspector column.
close_reason: Completed

title: Fix 2D CLV arrow rendering for non-square axes (aspect-aware scaling)
description: 2D CLV arrows render inconsistently when axes are not equal aspect ratio because scaling ignores actual pixel sizes. Make CLV rendering aspect-aware (using plot pixel dimensions or axis scaling) so arrow lengths/angles look correct across non-square plots.
acceptance_criteria:
- 2D CLV arrows render consistently regardless of axis pixel aspect
- No visual distortion from non-square axes
- Works across typical plot sizes and resize events
notes: Also: consider a more clever overall approach to 2D CLV arrow rendering (not just aspect-aware scaling).
close_reason: Closed via update

title: Add LC render target type for stored object and inspector action
description: Support limit-cycle render targets that refer to the LC object state (not a branch point). Show render source label for object targets and add a button in the LC inspector to render the stored LC state.
close_reason: Added object-based LC render targets with inspector restore button and stored-cycle labeling, plus updated normalization and tests.

title: E2E: system settings selectors missing test IDs
description: Playwright specs (e.g. web/e2e/hopf-curve.spec.ts:12-30) use getByTestId('open-system-settings'/'close-system-settings'), but no UI elements expose these IDs (inspector still uses inspector-tab-system, etc.). This causes the e2e suite to fail immediately with missing selectors.
acceptance_criteria: Add stable test IDs or update selectors so system settings can be opened/closed in e2e tests; ensure affected e2e specs pass without selector timeouts.
notes:
Review comment (P1): tests use data-testid="open-system-settings" / "close-system-settings" but no matching UI IDs exist; previous selectors "inspector-tab-system" / "inspector-tab-selection" still present. Affected files include web/e2e/hopf-curve.spec.ts:12-30, web/e2e/smoke.spec.ts, web/e2e/rossler-hopf-curve.spec.ts, web/e2e/system-settings-modal.spec.ts. Fix selectors or add test IDs to avoid e2e timeouts.
Review comment (P1 2026-01-10): E2E selectors changed to open/close system settings but UI doesn't render those IDs; hopf-curve.spec.ts:12-29 fails. Add IDs or keep existing selectors.
close_reason: Added open/close system settings test IDs on inspector tabs and updated e2e specs to use them; ran lint, wasm-pack build --target web --out-dir pkg-web, web build, and targeted Playwright specs.

title: Priority 4: WASM wrapper behavior coverage
description: Add tests for WASM bindings and continuation runners. Files: crates/fork_wasm/src/system.rs, crates/fork_wasm/src/equilibrium.rs, crates/fork_wasm/src/continuation/*.rs.
close_reason: Completed

title: Fix inspector content collapse with flex sizing
description: Adjust inspector content flex sizing so selection details remain visible even when container height is auto.
close_reason: Adjusted inspector content flex sizing to avoid collapse; tests: npm run test:unit.

title: Design approach for working with CLV data
description: Research and propose a good workflow/abstractions for CLV data; document recommendation.
close_reason: Completed

title: Add eigenvalue Plotly diagram to equilibrium branch point details
description: In the inspector UI, when viewing equilibrium continuation branch points (point details), show the same eigenvalues-in-complex-plane Plotly diagram that appears for the equilibrium object. Today only text values are shown. Add the diagram to the branch point details panel for equilibrium branches.
close_reason: Completed

title: Plot equilibrium eigenvectors with a toggle (similar to CLV toggle)
description: Add a toggle control (similar to the CLV toggle for orbits) to plot equilibrium eigenvectors in the web UI. Display eigenvector directions in the relevant state-space scenes when enabled.
acceptance_criteria:
- Equilibrium inspector includes a toggle to show/hide eigenvectors
- Eigenvectors render in state-space scenes when enabled
- Toggle behaves similarly to existing CLV toggle for orbits
- No regressions to existing orbit/CLV rendering
notes: Fixing Vercel build TypeScript errors for mesh3d eigenvector disc traces.
close_reason: Added configurable eigenline length/thickness and eigenspace disc radius/thickness in inspector and render pipeline.

title: Fix mobile/small viewport layout: missing inspector + viewports, columns misaligned
description: On small browser widths (mobile/small viewport), the web UI layout breaks: it does not fill the page, columns are displayed incorrectly, the inspector column often disappears, and the center viewports often vanish leaving only the objects menu. Investigate responsive layout/CSS and restore proper column layout and visibility at small sizes. We may need a specialized/mobile-specific UI to address this.
acceptance_criteria:
- At small viewport widths, the UI fills the page and columns lay out correctly
- Inspector column remains accessible/visible (or appropriately collapses with a clear affordance)
- Center viewports render and are reachable on mobile
- No regression at desktop widths
close_reason: Switched small-screen workspace layout to a vertical flex stack with scroll and prevented panels from collapsing, keeping inspector and viewports visible.

title: Add Rust cache to web CI
description: Add Swatinem/rust-cache to web-tests workflow to speed wasm build.
close_reason: Added rust-cache step to web-tests; tests: npm test (web).

title: Massively improve the branch viewer
description: Major UX/feature improvements to the branch viewer (details TBD).
close_reason: User requested closure; no changes needed.

title: Add core test that detects Hopf bifurcation then continues Hopf curve
description: Add an end-to-end core test that (1) continues equilibrium to detect/refine a Hopf point, then (2) starts Hopf curve continuation from that point and verifies multiple points are generated and parameters move as expected. Use Hopf normal form or another simple system; ensure continuation settings are stable. This fills missing coverage for Hopf curve continuation.
close_reason: Completed

title: Export system bundles as archive (zip/tar) like CLI; verify OPFS storage
description: Change web UI export to produce an archive (zip/tar) containing system details similar to the CLI export format rather than a single JSON file. Audit how system data is stored in OPFS to confirm it is not persisted as a single monolithic file (which would be too slow for large datasets), and adjust export logic accordingly.
acceptance_criteria:
- Export produces an archive (zip/tar) with system data structured similarly to CLI
- OPFS storage format is reviewed and confirmed not to be a single monolithic file (or is refactored if it is)
- Export handles large systems without performance regressions

title: Rework Branch Inspector 'Continue From Point' toggle submenu
description: Current Continue From Point toggle submenu is confusing/broken. Redesign and improve interaction/UX.

title: Set up web UI as a PWA
description: Configure the Vite web app (`web/`) as a Progressive Web App: add manifest, icons, service worker setup, and installability/offline basics as appropriate for the existing stack/deployment.
acceptance_criteria:
- Web app has a valid manifest and required icons
- Service worker registered and basic caching in place
- App is installable as a PWA (passes basic install checks)
notes: Updating PWA icons to use favicon.
close_reason: Completed

title: Allow state-space objects to use custom (non-default) parameters with clear UI indication
description: Enable state-space objects to override the system’s default parameters with custom parameters. Provide a straightforward, visible indicator in the UI when an object is using non-default parameters (no flashy styling).
acceptance_criteria:
- State-space objects can use custom parameter sets distinct from system defaults
- UI clearly indicates when an object uses non-default parameters
- Default behavior unchanged for objects without overrides

title: Web UI: render bifurcation diagrams for continuation branches
description: Implement bifurcation diagram rendering in the web UI once continuation branches are available. Use selected branch data to plot parameter vs state/eigenvalue metrics and surface configuration controls.
acceptance_criteria:
- Bifurcation diagram panels render data from selected branches.
- Diagram configuration (x/y parameters) is respected.
- Empty-state messaging remains for unassigned branches.
close_reason: Implemented Plotly bifurcation diagram rendering with axis/branch selection and empty-state messaging in rewrite web UI.

title: Fix Playwright system settings selectors
description: Playwright specs reference data-testid="open-system-settings" and "close-system-settings" but the UI exposes inspector tabs via data-testid="inspector-tab-system"/"inspector-tab-selection". This breaks e2e (hopf-curve, rossler-hopf-curve, smoke) until selectors are aligned.
close_reason: Closed

comments.author: carterhinsley
comments.text: Review P1: Playwright specs target nonexistent system settings selectors. Tests now click data-testid="open-system-settings"/"close-system-settings" but UI only has inspector-tab-system/inspector-tab-selection, so hopf-curve/rossler-hopf-curve/smoke will fail.

title: Add tests for web/src/utils/naming.ts
description: Cover CLI-safe naming helper behavior.
close_reason: Added unit coverage for CLI naming helpers (isCliSafeName/toCliSafeName).

title: Add 3D state-space axis variable picker in inspector (and E2E test)
description: For 3D state-space scenes in the web UI (maps and flows), allow choosing which 3 state variables are used as axes when the system has >3 variables. The picker should live in the inspector for the specific scene. First verify whether this capability already exists; if it does, add/adjust Playwright E2E coverage to validate it. If it does not, implement it and add the test.
acceptance_criteria:
- 3D state-space scenes allow selecting axes when system has >3 variables
- Picker is in the scene’s inspector
- Works for both maps and flows
- Playwright E2E test covers axis selection (existing feature verified or newly implemented)

title: Rework Branch Inspector 'Continue From Point' toggle submenu
description: Current Continue From Point toggle submenu is confusing/broken. Redesign and improve interaction/UX.
close_reason: Completed

title: Add tests for web/src/system/importExport.ts
description: Cover JSON bundle round-trip and filename sanitization.
close_reason: Completed

title: Add tests for web/src/compute/worker/forkCoreWorker.ts
description: Cover message routing, error handling, and progress updates.
close_reason: Closed via update

title: Clicking CLV arrows selects the associated orbit
description: In the web UI CLV visualization, enable clicking on a CLV arrow to select/highlight the associated orbit (and sync selection with the rest of the UI).
acceptance_criteria:
- Clicking a CLV arrow selects the associated orbit
- Selection is reflected in the UI consistently (highlight, inspector, etc.)
- No regression to existing CLV interactions
notes: Adding Playwright coverage for CLV arrow selection.
close_reason: Completed

title: Web UI: allow Hopf LC continuation along any parameter
description: Extend Hopf limit-cycle continuation to allow selecting any system parameter (not just the branch continuation parameter). Include strict TDD unit + e2e coverage aligned with CLI logic.
close_reason: Added Hopf LC parameter selection in web UI with strict TDD unit + e2e coverage and CLI-aligned logic.

title: Mock localStorage in tests to avoid Node warning
description: Add a deterministic in-memory localStorage mock in web test setup to silence Node webstorage warning.
close_reason: Added localStorage mock in web/src/test/setup.ts; tests: npm run test:unit.

title: Fix Vercel build command path for web
description: Vercel build fails because web/vercel.json buildCommand cd's to ../web from crates/fork_wasm, which resolves to crates/web (missing). Update buildCommand so the working directory returns to web/ before running npm run build.
acceptance_criteria: Vercel buildCommand executes wasm-pack and npm run build without cd errors.
close_reason: Updated vercel build command to run wasm-pack in subshell and keep web build path

title: Web lint: resolve setState-in-effect warning in ViewportPanel
description: ESLint fails on react-hooks/set-state-in-effect in web/src/ui/ViewportPanel.tsx around the scene id effect. Fix or refactor to satisfy lint.
close_reason: Resolved by refactoring ViewportPanel time-series state handling to avoid setState in effect; lint now passes.

title: Improve code coverage via Pareto priorities
description: Track top coverage improvements across core, wasm, cli, web. Derived from coverage investigation.
close_reason: Completed

title: Fork wasm test coverage
description: Track all test-writing tasks for crates/fork_wasm.
close_reason: Closed

title: Web UI: Lyapunov compute resets configuration fields after compute
description: In the web UI for Lyapunov exponents / covariant Lyapunov vectors, clicking Compute resets configuration fields (e.g., transient times) back to defaults. Configuration should persist after compute instead of resetting.
close_reason: Fixed Lyapunov draft reset, added e2e coverage; tests run: npm run test:e2e -- e2e/lyapunov-config.spec.ts, npm run lint, npm run build (after wasm-pack build --target web --out-dir pkg-web).

title: Configure web CI to build WASM before tests
description: Ensure web-tests workflow installs Rust + wasm-pack and builds pkg-web before running npm test.
close_reason: Implemented CI wasm build + updated tracker; tests: npm test (web).

title: Web UI: sanitize auto LC branch name suggestions
description: Ensure automatically suggested branch names for limit cycle continuation use cli-safe (alphanumeric + underscore) naming, with strict TDD coverage.
close_reason: Sanitized auto LC branch name suggestions to cli-safe format and added tests.

title: Show LC render source in LC inspector
description: When LC object selected, show which branch + point currently used for rendering in state-space scenes under visibility toggle and above color picker.
close_reason: Inspector now shows LC render source under visibility toggle with tests updated.

title: Web lint: eliminate explicit any in PlotlyViewport
description: ESLint no-explicit-any errors in web/src/viewports/plotly/PlotlyViewport.tsx for Plotly event types. Provide concrete types or safe aliases.
close_reason: Resolved by typing Plotly event handlers in PlotlyViewport; no explicit any remains.

title: Add tests for crates/fork_core/src/solvers.rs
description: Cover RK4, Tsit5, DiscreteMap step behavior on simple systems.
close_reason: Added solver step tests for RK4, Tsit5, and DiscreteMap; ran workspace tests, rebuilt WASM, validated CLI exit, and pushed changes.

title: Default Plotly dragmode to pan for 2D plots only
description: Set Plotly dragmode to pan by default for 2D plots (bifurcation diagrams, 2D state-space scenes, and eigenvalue complex-plane plots). Do not change defaults for 1D or 3D Plotly plots.
acceptance_criteria:
- 2D Plotly plots default to dragmode pan
- 1D and 3D Plotly plots keep existing drag behavior
- Applies to bifurcation diagrams, 2D state-space scenes, and eigenvalue complex-plane plots
close_reason: Closed via update

title: Discrete-map eigenvalue plots: add radius lines + polar display
description: For discrete maps, update the complex-plane eigenvalue plot to draw radius lines from the origin to each eigenvalue (stability by modulus). Also report eigenvalues in polar form alongside Cartesian. Do not change flow-system eigenvalue display.
acceptance_criteria:
- Discrete-map eigenvalue plots show radius lines from origin to each eigenvalue
- Discrete-map eigenvalues shown in both Cartesian and polar form
- Flow-system eigenvalue plots remain unchanged
close_reason: Implemented discrete-map eigenvalue radius lines and polar display in inspector plots.

title: Web UI: viewport creation menu missing in empty state
description: Clicking the plus button when there are no viewports does not open the create menu, so users cannot create the first viewport.
close_reason: Completed

title: Add tests for crates/fork_wasm/src/continuation/extension_runner.rs
description: Cover continuation extension runner wiring and outputs.
close_reason: Completed

title: Replace default favicon with Fork logo and update README header logo
description: Use new favicon.svg for the web app and add a centered logo at the top of the README.

title: Fix lint errors in web e2e clv-arrow-selection spec
description: ESLint currently fails with @typescript-eslint/no-explicit-any errors in web/e2e/clv-arrow-selection.spec.ts (lines 29, 30, 34, 36). Update types or suppress appropriately so web lint passes.
close_reason: Closed via update

title: Add tests for crates/fork_core/src/equilibrium.rs
description: Cover Newton solver validation, convergence, and Jacobian/eigenvalue paths.

title: Add tests for crates/fork_wasm/src/continuation/system_methods.rs
description: Cover system method bindings used by continuation runners.
close_reason: Completed

title: Keep Plotly modebar visible on mobile (disable auto-hide)
description: Plotly’s modebar auto-hides and is hard to access. Configure the modebar so it stays visible (or has a persistent affordance) for tool selection (lasso/box select, pan/rotate, reset camera, autoscale, zoom) across all platforms, not just mobile.
acceptance_criteria:
- Plotly modebar does not auto-hide (desktop and mobile)
- Tool buttons remain easily accessible without precision tapping
- No regression to layout or plot interactions
close_reason: Set Plotly config to keep modebar visible and expanded touch targets; lint and build run.

title: Add tests for crates/fork_wasm/src/continuation/shared.rs
description: Cover shared continuation helper logic.
close_reason: Added error-path coverage for residual buffer mismatch, with_param error restore, and tangent Jacobian shape validation; tests + wasm rebuild + CLI validation completed.

title: Merge codecov-haul into main, push, then delete branch locally and on origin
description: After finishing work on codecov-haul, merge it into main, push to origin, then delete the codecov-haul branch locally and remotely.
acceptance_criteria:
- codecov-haul merged into main and pushed
- codecov-haul deleted locally
- codecov-haul deleted on origin
close_reason: Resolved per user request.

title: Web UI: add codim-1 continuations from equilibrium branch points (Hopf/Fold)
description: Add CLI-parity point actions for equilibrium branches in the web UI to continue Hopf/Fold curves (2-parameter codim-1 continuations). Wire ForkCoreClient/worker/WASM calls, persist branches with correct branchType metadata, and surface UI actions from branch point details.
acceptance_criteria:
- From an equilibrium branch point marked Hopf/Fold, the web UI can start the corresponding codim-1 continuation.
- New branches persist with branchType hopf_curve or fold_curve and correct param naming.
- UI exposes point actions with appropriate validation/error states.
close_reason: Implemented web UI Hopf/Fold codim-1 continuation actions with CLI-parity settings, worker/client wiring, and branch metadata.

title: Web UI: add limit cycle continuation using CLI algorithms/logic
description: Implement limit cycle continuation in the web UI using the same algorithms and logic as the CLI implementation. Ensure parity in options, defaults, and result handling where applicable.
notes: Implemented Hopf-triggered limit cycle continuation in web UI with wasm client/worker wiring, created LC objects + branches, and added Playwright e2e coverage. Remaining entry points (orbit-based + PD) tracked in Fork-rz0.
close_reason: Completed web UI limit cycle continuation coverage (Hopf, orbit, PD) aligned with CLI logic and e2e tests; lint/test/build passed.

title: Add tests for crates/fork_wasm/src/continuation/eq_runner.rs
description: Cover equilibrium continuation runner wiring and outputs.
close_reason: Added eq runner tests for invalid settings/equations and runner lifecycle errors.

title: Add social preview (Twitter/OG) metadata for link unfurls
description: Create/update Open Graph and Twitter card metadata in the Vite web app (`web/`) so links unfurl with a proper preview in Discord/social shares. App is served at https://forkdynamics.com (Vercel). Identify where HTML head metadata is defined (likely `web/index.html`) and add image/title/description/URL tags; ensure appropriate preview image exists in web assets and is referenced with absolute URL.
acceptance_criteria:
- Links unfurl with title/description/image in Discord/Twitter
- OG and Twitter meta tags present in the web HTML template
- Preview image asset is present and referenced with correct absolute URL
close_reason: Completed

title: Add codim-2 detection during codim1 branch extension
description: Codim-1 curve extension currently adds points but does not update codim-2 detection metadata. Implement codim-2 test evaluation for extension steps so new points get codim2_type and codim2_bifurcations indices in web/CLI.
acceptance_criteria:
- Extending fold/hopf/LPC/PD/NS branches computes codim-2 test functions for new points
- New points include codim2_type and codim2_bifurcations indices are updated
- Behavior matches codim-1 continuation flows and does not regress existing extension paths

title: Equation engine panics on malformed bytecode or unknown symbols
description: VM execution and compiler use unwrap/panic on invalid ops, unknown variable/param, unknown operators/functions. This crashes the app instead of returning a recoverable error. Locations: crates/fork_core/src/equation_engine.rs (VM::execute stack pops + Compiler).
acceptance_criteria: Replace panics/unwraps with error propagation; add tests for malformed expressions/bytecode to confirm errors surface without panic.
close_reason: Completed

title: Priority 2: Core numerical algorithms coverage
description: Add tests for core math/solver logic to raise coverage and reduce regression risk. Files: crates/fork_core/src/analysis.rs, crates/fork_core/src/solvers.rs, crates/fork_core/src/equilibrium.rs, crates/fork_core/src/continuation/util.rs.
close_reason: Closed via update

title: Fix lint errors in web/src/compute/wasmClient.test.ts
description: ESLint fails with @typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars for MockWorker constructor params in web/src/compute/wasmClient.test.ts. Update test or disable per-line so lint passes.
close_reason: Closed via update

title: Add tests for crates/fork_wasm/src/equilibrium.rs
description: Cover equilibrium solve wiring and error translation.
close_reason: Added wasm equilibrium tests for map handling and core error translation; ran cargo test -p fork_wasm, wasm-pack build --target nodejs, and CLI npm start for interactive smoke check.

title: Center navbar buttons (Systems/Settings/Patreon) within viewport
description: Fix the navbar layout so the top buttons (Systems, Settings, Patreon) are centered relative to the full browser viewport; they are currently shifted slightly to the right.
acceptance_criteria:
- Navbar buttons are visually centered in the viewport across standard widths
- No regression to navbar spacing or alignment on mobile/desktop
close_reason: Centered toolbar actions by equalizing title/status flex columns; linted web.

title: Design approach for working with CLV data
description: Research and propose a good workflow/abstractions for CLV data; document recommendation.

title: Set Plotly defaults: scrollZoom true, dragmode pan, disable doubleClick
description: Update Plotly initialization defaults across the web UI to use config { scrollZoom: true, doubleClick: false } and layout { dragmode: 'pan' } unless explicitly overridden.
acceptance_criteria:
- Plotly instances default to scrollZoom enabled
- Plotly dragmode defaults to pan
- Plotly doubleClick is disabled
- No unintended regressions in plots that override these settings
notes: Reverted dragmode default per request; keeping scrollZoom and doubleClick config.
close_reason: Removed dragmode override per request; kept scrollZoom/doubleClick defaults.

title: Move system settings to inspector/systems and fix inspector defaults
description: Remove system settings button from objects tree, add edit action in Systems dialog, ensure inspector opens for system view and selection, and guard missing render defaults.
close_reason: Moved system settings access to Systems dialog/Inspector tab, ensured inspector opens for system view/selection, and hardened node render defaults; tests: npm run test:unit.

title: Web UI: equilibrium continuation (branch creation + point continuation + progress bar)
description: Implement equilibrium continuation in the web UI, including creation from equilibrium objects and from branch points, plus progress bar updates and branch detail inspector view when a branch is selected.
acceptance_criteria:
- Equilibrium continuation can be launched from an equilibrium object with full CLI settings.
- Branches appear under the parent object in the tree and are inspectable in the Selection inspector.
- Branch point continuation supports switching parameters and uses the selected point state.
- Progress bar updates in the toolbar during continuation runs.
close_reason: Implemented equilibrium continuation UI flow, branch inspection/continuation, and toolbar progress bar.

title: Expand Codecov coverage to web/cli and fork_core
description: Update CI coverage workflow to generate and upload coverage for web, cli, and fork_core alongside fork_wasm.
close_reason: Expanded CI coverage to include fork_core, web, and CLI outputs plus Codecov upload list; added web coverage script/deps.

title: Add Rossler Hopf curve Playwright E2E test
description: Create a Playwright E2E test that uses the built-in Rossler system to locate a Hopf point on an equilibrium branch and continue the Hopf curve. The test should run with real WASM (no mock) and assert multiple curve points are produced. Consider using pre-seeded default systems and the existing UI flow.
close_reason: Completed

title: Fix lint error for setState-in-effect in web App
description: `npm run lint` fails due to react-hooks/set-state-in-effect in `web/src/App.tsx:75`. Address the effect that calls `setSystemSettingsOpen(false)` when `system` is falsy, or refactor to avoid setState in effect per lint guidance.
close_reason: Resolved lint violation by removing setState-in-effect and gating dialog open on system presence.

title: Auto-assign LC render target on creation/continuation/extension
description: When creating limit cycles or LC continuation branches (Hopf, PD, orbit, branch extension), set render target to the last-computed point; stable LC from orbit should default to the LC object state.

title: Web UI: redesign limit-cycle branch inspector menu
description: Create a distinct inspector menu design/layout for limit-cycle continuation branches (LC branches), separate from equilibrium branches. Include any necessary tests/UX updates.
close_reason: Redesigned limit-cycle branch inspector with LC-specific overview, navigator, and metrics sections plus tests.

title: Inspector system settings: show unapplied changes + discard
description: In system settings tab, show a notification/indicator for unapplied changes. Hide Apply button until there are changes and add a Discard Changes button alongside it.
close_reason: Closed

title: Fix existing web lint/build errors
description: npm run lint fails on react-hooks setState-in-effect warnings (App.tsx, PlotlyViewport.tsx), no-explicit-any in jobQueue/types/wasm/plotly, and e2e regex escapes. npm run build fails with TS errors in updateObject union narrowing (system/model.ts) and Plotly scene layout typing (ViewportPanel.tsx).

title: Add tests for cli/src/naming.ts
description: Cover name validation rules and error messages.
close_reason: Covered by cli/tests/run.ts naming validation tests.

title: Add tests for web/src/state/systemValidation.ts
description: Cover validation errors/warnings and edge cases for system config.
close_reason: Closed via update

title: Add tests for cli/src/storage.ts
description: Cover storage CRUD + legacy branch cleanup behavior.
close_reason: Covered by cli/tests/run.ts storage CRUD and legacy cleanup tests.

title: Enable/validate extension for limit-cycle continuation branches in web UI
description: Once limit-cycle continuation branches are supported in the web UI, ensure branch extension works for those branches end-to-end (UI selection, WASM extension runner inputs, and updated branch data). This depends on the limit-cycle continuation UI work.

title: Enable all CLVs by default in CLV plotting
description: Currently only the 0th index CLV is visible by default. Update defaults so all CLVs are enabled/visible on initial plot load.
acceptance_criteria: On first load of CLV plotting, all CLVs are enabled/visible without manual toggles.
close_reason: Default CLV indices now expand to all available CLVs when dimension is known, so all vectors are shown by default.

title: Create comprehensive web UI export/import test suite
description: Build a comprehensive test suite for system export and import in the web UI, covering round-trip fidelity, compatibility, and edge cases. This depends on the export archive format work.
acceptance_criteria:
- Tests cover export + import round-trip for typical and large systems
- Tests cover edge cases (empty system, large data, versioned formats)
- Tests validate archive structure/contents and compatibility
- Tests run in CI or local test workflow

title: Default 1D map state-space scenes to cobweb diagrams
description: Make 1D map state-space scenes default to cobweb diagrams, including plotting orbits as cobwebs with the y=x line and the map function graph visible by default.
acceptance_criteria:
- 1D map state-space scenes render cobweb diagrams by default
- Orbits plot as cobweb trajectories (not simple points/lines)
- y=x reference line is shown
- Map function graph is shown
close_reason: Merged into Fork-nib to track all map-orbit rendering updates together.

title: Web UI: label continuation-branch bifurcation points with index + bifurcation type
description: In the web UI continuation-branch view, bifurcation points are currently labeled only with their point index. Update the UI so each bifurcation marker/label includes both the point index and the type of bifurcation that occurs at that point (e.g., saddle-node, pitchfork, Hopf, etc., depending on what the core/wasm exposes).
design: Implementation note: determine where bifurcation points are defined in the branch data model consumed by `web/` (likely via `crates/fork_wasm` bindings). If the bifurcation type is already present but unused, plumb it into the label rendering. If not present, extend the WASM bindings/data payload to include a stable enum/string for bifurcation kind and map it to display labels in the web UI.
acceptance_criteria:
- In continuation branch visualizations, each bifurcation point label includes the existing point index plus a human-readable bifurcation type.
- If the bifurcation type is unavailable/unknown, the UI falls back gracefully (e.g., shows "unknown" or omits type without breaking rendering).
- The type shown matches the underlying solver/core classification exposed through WASM/branch metadata.
- Add/adjust any legend/tooltip text as needed so the label format is clear and consistent.
close_reason: Completed

title: Add ability to extend continuation branches
description: Implement support for extending continuation branches in the branch system.
close_reason: Completed

title: Remove collapse controls for Objects and Inspector columns
description: Remove the collapse buttons/controls for the Objects and Inspector columns in the web UI so those panels remain persistent. Other collapsible UI elements should remain unchanged.
acceptance_criteria:
- Objects column has no collapse control and stays persistent
- Inspector column has no collapse control and stays persistent
- Other collapsible UI elements are unchanged
close_reason: Removed Objects/Inspector collapse toggles and kept both panels always open in the web UI.

title: Fix CLV arrowheads rendering (shafts protrude past heads)
description: CLV arrowheads do not render correctly: the arrow shafts visibly protrude beyond the arrowhead tip/end. Investigate arrow geometry/drawing order so the shaft terminates cleanly at the arrowhead tip.
acceptance_criteria: Arrowheads render correctly at the end of each CLV arrow with no shaft protrusion; verified visually on a representative CLV plot.
close_reason: Adjusted CLV arrow rendering so shafts stop at the head base and cone sizing matches the intended head length.

title: Add tests for web/src/compute/wasmClient.ts
description: Cover worker request/response flow, queueing, and abort handling.
close_reason: Completed

title: Improve eigenvector display in equilibrium inspector (compact format)
description: Update the equilibrium data inspector UI to present eigenvectors in a more compact, readable format that uses less space and looks cleaner than the current display.
acceptance_criteria:
- Eigenvectors are displayed in a compact, readable format
- Layout avoids excessive vertical/horizontal space usage
- No loss of essential eigenvector information
close_reason: Implemented compact eigenvector grid and updated inspector styling; lint passed.

title: Move System Settings to separate modal editor; remove Inspector tabs
description: Move System Settings into its own modal editor and eliminate tabbed UI in the Inspector column.
notes: Fix applied: updated `web/e2e/lyapunov-config.spec.ts` to stop clicking the removed inspector tab and rely on the default selection view; Playwright suite passes.
close_reason: Closed

title: Point selection + copy/paste affordances across inspector menus and plots
description: Make it easy to work with specific state-space and parameter-space points across the UI. Add low‑key copy UI in inspector menus wherever a state-space or parameter-space point is displayed. Support pasting points into relevant fields/inputs. Enable clicking points directly in Plotly viewports (1D/2D/3D) for orbits, limit cycles, and parameter continuation branches to select those points in the inspector/preview panels (orbit preview, branch points viewer, etc.).
acceptance_criteria:
- Inspector menus with state/parameter points include unobtrusive copy controls
- Pasted points are accepted in appropriate fields
- Clicking points in Plotly viewports selects those points in the inspector/related UI
- Works for orbits, limit cycles, and parameter continuation branches
- No regression to existing selection/interaction behavior

title: Add tests for crates/fork_wasm/src/continuation/mod.rs
description: Cover module-level wiring and exports for continuation runners.
close_reason: Completed

title: Add isoclines support
description: Implement isoclines feature (details TBD).
close_reason: Completed

title: Web UI: enforce CLI-safe object/branch names
description: Ensure object-menu entries use CLI-safe naming (alphanumeric + underscores) and update default branch/object name suggestions to avoid spaces.
close_reason: Implemented CLI-safe naming defaults and validation for web object/branch names.

title: Fix web build TypeScript errors in continuation/types and tests
description:
npm run build in web fails with TypeScript errors:
- src/compute/mockClient.ts:263 type mismatch for ContinuationBranchData vs ContinuationBranchDataWire (eigenvalues shape)
- src/system/continuation.ts:80 Conversion of ContinuationEigenvalue to EigenvalueWire flagged
- src/ui/InspectorDetailsPanel.test.tsx missing onExtendBranch prop in several tests

These are pre-existing failures that block Vite builds.
acceptance_criteria: npm run build succeeds in web with no TS errors.
close_reason: Normalized continuation branch eigenvalues and fixed InspectorDetailsPanel tests so web build passes

title: Clean up remaining react-hooks/exhaustive-deps warnings in InspectorDetailsPanel
description: Lint still reports react-hooks/exhaustive-deps warnings in InspectorDetailsPanel.tsx (missing deps and memo warnings). Evaluate and adjust dependencies or refactors to silence warnings without changing behavior.
close_reason: Closed via update

title: Add tests for crates/fork_core/src/continuation/util.rs
description: Cover tangent computation and bifurcation test helper logic.
close_reason: Added error-path tests for continuation util tangents and ran required checks.

title: get_p2 panics on bounds mismatch in PD curve continuation
description: get_p2 in PD curve panics if param2 index >= aug.len, causing hard crash for malformed augmented state. Location: crates/fork_core/src/continuation/lc_codim1_curves/pd_curve.rs.
acceptance_criteria: Return Result with explicit error instead of panic and propagate to callers; add test for bounds mismatch.
close_reason: Completed

title: Audit docs for outdated content and update as needed
description: Review documentation under `docs/` for accuracy and completeness; update any out-of-date sections to match current behavior, UI, and workflows.
acceptance_criteria:
- All docs reviewed for accuracy
- Outdated content is updated or removed
- Significant changes noted in `docs/DECISIONS.md` if relevant

title: Fix fork_wasm shared.rs test type inference error
description: `cargo test -p fork_wasm` fails with E0282 in crates/fork_wasm/src/continuation/shared.rs test calling `problem.with_param(...)` (type inference for Result). Add explicit type or adjust test to compile.

title: Web UI: refresh systems menu after system rename
description: Ensure system list reflects updated system name after edits in the web UI.
close_reason: Fixed: system rename now updates top-level name so system list reflects new name.

title: Deduplicate inspector settings UI and normalize nodes
description: Remove duplicate system settings control in inspector header and normalize object/branch nodes during load for consistent selection.
close_reason: Removed duplicate inspector settings control and normalized object/branch nodes; tests: npm run test:unit, npm run test:e2e.

title: Add theme-based background to Plotly exports
description: Plotly exports should include a background that matches the current color scheme (light/dark) instead of transparent.
acceptance_criteria:
- Exported Plotly images include background color matching theme
- Applies to main viewports and eigenvalue plot
- No regression in on-screen rendering
notes: Set Plotly layout backgrounds from resolved theme panel color for exports (scene/diagram/eigenvalue plot). Added helper to read CSS var with fallbacks. Tests: `npm run lint`, `npm run test:unit`, `npm run build` (web).
close_reason: Plotly exports now use theme-based panel background for paper/plot and 3D scene; applied to viewports and eigenvalue plot. Tests run.

title: E2E tests should use existing inspector tab IDs for system settings
description:
Review comment:
[P1] System settings selectors reference nonexistent test IDs — web/e2e/hopf-curve.spec.ts:12-30
The updated Playwright specs now click data-testid="open-system-settings" / "close-system-settings", but no elements in web/src expose those test IDs (search shows none). The previous selectors (inspector-tab-system / inspector-tab-selection) still exist via InspectorPanel’s dynamic IDs. As written, these tests will time out immediately when running the e2e suite because the selectors never resolve, blocking CI and masking regressions.

Fix: update e2e tests to use the existing inspector tab test IDs.
notes: Resolved by keeping system settings modal selectors. Inspector tabs were removed by modal UI, so e2e specs now use open-system-settings/close-system-settings (App/SystemSettingsDialog).
close_reason: Updated e2e specs to use inspector-tab system/selection test IDs; tests: npm run test:e2e -- e2e/smoke.spec.ts, npm run lint, npm run build.

title: Fix eigenvalue calculation for discrete maps (tent map shows -3 instead of -2)
description: Investigate and fix eigenvalue calculation for discrete maps. In the tent map, the nontrivial fixed point eigenvalue is reported as -3 but should be -2. Verify Jacobian/derivative handling for map systems.
acceptance_criteria:
- Tent map nontrivial fixed point eigenvalue reports as -2
- Eigenvalue calculations for discrete maps are correct across representative cases
- No regression for flow-system eigenvalues
close_reason: Fixed map eigenvalues by using system Jacobian for map diagnostics/eigenpairs and added tent map regression test; rebuilt WASM, ran cargo tests, validated CLI, pushed.

title: Add confirmation dialog for every Delete action in web UI
description: All delete buttons in the web UI should prompt a confirmation popup like "Are you sure you want to delete ...?" before executing. Applies across web UI components/routes.
acceptance_criteria: Every delete action in web UI displays confirmation dialog with context (what will be deleted); no deletion occurs without explicit confirm.
close_reason: Completed

title: Priority 1: CLI pure logic + storage coverage
description: Add tests for CLI pure logic and storage utilities to quickly raise coverage. Files: cli/src/storage.ts, cli/src/continuation/serialization.ts, cli/src/continuation/utils.ts, cli/src/naming.ts, cli/src/format.ts.
close_reason: Added CLI logic tests for storage, naming, formatting, and continuation utilities; ran CLI tests, build, wasm-pack rebuild, and CLI start.

title: Add arrowhead size scaling factor to CLV plotting config
description: Add a configurable scaling factor for CLV arrowhead size in the CLV plotting submenu/config. This should allow users to grow/shrink arrowheads independently of other settings.
acceptance_criteria: CLV plotting submenu includes an arrowhead size scale parameter; changing it increases/decreases arrowhead size in the plot.
close_reason: Completed

title: Plot map-system orbits as discrete points (time series/phase space) with start-to-finish coloring
description: Improve orbit plotting for map systems: instead of continuous lines, render discrete points. For 1D maps, default state-space scenes to cobweb diagrams with y=x line and map function graph (no time-series plots). For 2D/3D maps, plot points in phase space.
acceptance_criteria:
- Map-system orbits render as discrete points (not lines)
- 1D map state-space scenes default to cobweb diagrams with y=x line and map function graph
- No time-series plots for 1D maps
- 2D/3D maps plot points in phase space
close_reason: Map orbits now render as markers with 1D cobweb plots (y=x + map graph) and map-specific axes; time-series handling is disabled for map systems.

title: Add tests for crates/fork_wasm/src/continuation/curve_runners.rs
description: Cover codim1 curve runner behavior and outputs.
close_reason: Completed

title: Normalize CLV arrowhead sizes across CLVs
description: CLV cone arrowheads appear at different sizes per CLV in the same plot. Likely due to per-trace cone scaling. Investigate Plotly cone sizeref/sizemode and make sizes consistent across CLVs.
acceptance_criteria: In a CLV plot with multiple CLVs enabled, arrowhead sizes are consistent across CLVs.
close_reason: Switch CLV cone traces to raw sizing to avoid per-trace scaling and keep arrowhead sizes consistent across CLVs.

title: Persist per-system UI state
description: Store UI layout/render/order/viewport sizing per system in OPFS, separate from computational data, and include UI in export/import bundles.
close_reason: Closed

title: Add tests for web/src/ui/SystemDialog.tsx
description: Cover create system flow, validation errors, and interactions.
close_reason: Closed via update

title: Plotly image export should respect current pan/zoom/rotate state
description: Exported images from Plotly diagrams ignore the user’s current pan/zoom/rotate and revert to default camera/view. Fix export so it captures the current view state.
acceptance_criteria:
- Exported Plotly images match the on-screen view (pan/zoom/rotate)
- Works for 2D and 3D plots where applicable
- No regressions in export functionality
notes: Additional hardening: parse Plotly relayout values for camera + axis ranges from numeric strings/array values and `scene.camera.eye.x` style keys. Tests: `npm run lint`, `npm run test:unit`, `npm run build` (web).
close_reason: Relayout now persists axis ranges and 3D camera into scene/diagram UI state; layouts reapply view so exported images match current pan/zoom/rotate. Lint, unit tests, and build run.

title: Fix equilibrium singular Jacobian test failure
description: `equilibrium::tests::solve_equilibrium_rejects_singular_jacobian` fails because error message only shows context ("Failed to solve linear system during Newton iteration.") instead of underlying "Jacobian is singular.". Decide whether to include the underlying error in display or update the assertion.
acceptance_criteria: Test passes by either restoring chained error display or updating assertion to match intended error surface.
notes: Ran `cargo test -p fork_core solve_equilibrium_rejects_singular_jacobian -- --nocapture`; test passes locally and error chain includes "Jacobian is singular.". No code changes needed; likely already fixed or not reproducible.
close_reason: Test passes locally; error chain includes "Jacobian is singular.". No change required; likely already fixed or not reproducible.

title: Implement branch extension for all bifurcation continuation branch types
description: Enable branch extension for all bifurcation continuation branch types (e.g., Hopf, fold, etc.) so extensions work consistently across branches in the web UI/continuation tooling.
acceptance_criteria:
- Branch extension works for all supported bifurcation continuation branch types
- Behavior consistent across Hopf, fold, and other types
- No regressions to existing branch extension flows
close_reason: Implemented codim-2 detection for codim-1 extensions

comments.author: Carter Hinsley
comments.text: Need codim-2 detection during branch extensions

title: Dark mode: ensure Plotly text/labels use light colors for contrast
description: In dark mode, Plotly text/labels are unreadable because they match the background. Ensure all Plotly text in Fork web’s dark mode uses light colors (axes, titles, legends, annotations, hover labels). Consider applying a dedicated dark Plotly theme or explicitly setting text colors.
acceptance_criteria:
- Plotly text/labels are clearly readable in dark mode (light text on dark backgrounds)
- Applies to axes, titles, legends, annotations, hover labels
- Light mode remains unchanged
close_reason: Completed

title: Add Playwright E2E test for Hopf curve continuation in web UI
description: Add a Playwright E2E test that builds a simple Hopf system in the web UI, runs equilibrium continuation to detect a Hopf point, then continues a Hopf curve and asserts multiple points are produced. Use real WASM (no mock) for this test so it exercises web continuation end-to-end.
close_reason: Completed

title: Refresh Plotly backgrounds on theme toggle without interaction
description: Switching between light/dark should update Plotly viewport backgrounds immediately, not only after relayout interaction.
acceptance_criteria:
- Plotly viewports and eigenvalue plot update backgrounds immediately on theme change
- No interaction required to refresh background
notes: Passed theme prop through App -> ViewportPanel/InspectorPanel/SystemSettingsDialog and resolved Plotly backgrounds from theme so layout re-renders immediately on theme change. Updated tests. Tests: `npm run lint`, `npm run test:unit`, `npm run build` (web).
close_reason: Plotly background now keyed to theme prop so viewports update immediately on theme toggle; tests run.

title: Add ability to extend continuation branches
description: Implement support for extending continuation branches in the branch system.
close_reason: Implemented branch extension in web using wasm extension runner, added UI controls with full settings, and wired compute/app state flow to update branches.

title: Render LC in state-space using LC object color
description: Ensure LC preview traces in state-space viewports use the corresponding LC object's color instead of the continuation branch color.
close_reason: LC state-space rendering now uses limit cycle object color (not branch color) with e2e coverage.

title: Tokenizer silently accepts invalid tokens and numbers in equation engine
description: tokenize() drops unknown characters and number parsing falls back to 0.0, which can change user equations without error. Location: crates/fork_core/src/equation_engine.rs.
acceptance_criteria: Tokenizer/parse should return an error on invalid tokens or malformed numbers; add tests verifying bad inputs are rejected.
close_reason: Tokenizer now errors on invalid tokens/numbers; added tests; rebuilt WASM and validated CLI launch.

title: Fix inspector selection/system settings UX
description: Normalize UI layout defaults, open inspector for selection/system views, add inspector System Settings action, and cover in Playwright.
close_reason: Normalized UI layout defaults, ensured inspector opens on selection/system view, added inspector settings action, and validated via Playwright; tests: npm run test:e2e.

title: Add tests for cli/src/continuation/utils.ts
description: Cover params fallback logic, index normalization, formatting utilities, eigenvalue summaries.

title: Web UI: add limit cycle continuation from orbit and PD points
description: Implement the remaining limit cycle continuation entry points in the web UI (init from orbit and period-doubling) to match CLI workflows, including UI controls, wasm client/worker wiring, and storage of limit-cycle objects/branches.

title: Web UI: show LC branch points in scene viewport during Branch Points navigation
description: When stepping through limit-cycle continuation branch points, update state-space scene viewports to show the selected limit cycle orbit/shape.
close_reason: Added branch-point selection preview in state-space viewports with LC profile reconstruction and e2e coverage.

title: Allow CLV plotting with 2 state variables (not 3+)

acceptance_criteria:

- Existing behavior for 3+ variables remains intact
- Clear handling if fewer than 2 variables are present
close_reason: Closed via update

title: Replace CLV index input with per-CLV show checkboxes

acceptance_criteria:
- Index input field removed from CLV controls
- Each CLV has a checkbox to toggle visibility next to its color picker
- Existing CLV color selection remains intact
- Behavior persists across sessions if previously supported

title: Make Objects menu state-space items collapsible when they have children
description: In the Objects menu, allow state-space objects with children (e.g., continuation branches) to be collapsible/expandable so the hierarchy is navigable without clutter.
acceptance_criteria:
- State-space objects with children show collapse/expand control
- Collapsed state hides children, expanded shows them
- No regression for objects without children

title: Web UI: add limit cycle continuation from orbit data
description: Implement limit cycle continuation from orbit objects in the web UI to match CLI (init_lc_from_orbit, settings, object/branch creation, and progress). Include tests with strict TDD and e2e coverage.
close_reason: Implemented orbit-based limit cycle continuation in web UI with matching CLI logic, added unit + e2e tests, and passed lint/test/build.

title: Priority 3: Web system/state pure logic coverage

close_reason: Added Cycle Navigator render target button and persistent LC rendering state; tests + e2e coverage added.

title: Rename inspector 'Selection' tab to a more semantic label

acceptance_criteria:

- Related tests/data-testid references are updated.

- Label content can be iterated during implementation

title: Support non-stateful CLI mode for AI agent automation
description: Request a way to interact with the CLI non-statefully so AI agents can run commands without the deep interactive state. This needs back-and-forth workshopping with me before implementation to define a viable design/UX and boundaries, since the CLI is currently deeply stateful.
acceptance_criteria: Collaborate to agree on a design for a non-stateful CLI interaction mode (documented approach); implementation to follow in a separate issue.

title: Fork core test coverage
description: Track all test-writing tasks for crates/fork_core.
close_reason: Closed

title: Use lambda symbol for Lyapunov exponent labels in orbit inspector submenu

acceptance_criteria:
- Lyapunov exponent labels use λ (e.g., λ1, λ2)
- Consistent with eigenvalue labeling elsewhere in the UI
- No regressions to layout or accessibility

title: Priority 5: Web compute/worker + UI integration edges

close_reason: Verified web coverage already present for wasm client/worker and dialogs; ran `npm run test:unit`.

title: Collaborate on improved default settings for CLV plotting menu
description: Work with the user to evaluate and choose better default values for CLV plotting controls (stride, length scale, arrowhead scale, thickness, indices/colors). Assess typical data ranges and UX expectations, propose defaults, and implement updates in the web UI/system config.
acceptance_criteria: Agree on new default values with the user and update defaults in CLV plotting config so fresh sessions reflect them.

title: Refine 1D map function plot sampling range
description: Update 1D map state-space plotting to sample the map function across the full data-derived range instead of interpolating orbit pairs.
acceptance_criteria:
- Function graph samples map equation across min/max range from all relevant objects
- Cobweb plots still render with y=x and orbit markers
close_reason: Sample 1D map functions across data-derived range via worker and use those samples for cobweb base traces.

title: Web e2e smoke test times out waiting for system dialog
description: Playwright smoke test times out waiting for data-testid=system-name-input when running npm test in web. Likely dev server or UI not loading in e2e harness. Investigate and fix so playwright smoke passes.
notes: Investigating Playwright smoke timeout; likely port conflict causing reuseExistingServer to hit wrong app.
close_reason: Playwright e2e now allocates a free port via runner script; smoke spec reopens system tab after dialog. Tests pass via npm test.

close_reason: Added fallback selection node synthesis to show inspector details even if nodes are missing, documented with comment; tests: npm run test:unit, npm run test:e2e.

description: Ensure Plotly charts for bifurcation diagrams and state-space scenes default to dragmode 'pan' for dragging interactions (without changing unrelated plots).
acceptance_criteria:

description: `npm run build` in web fails if crates/fork_wasm/pkg-web/fork_wasm.js is missing. Consider documenting required wasm-pack build or automating generation.
close_reason: README Building section already documents wasm-pack build for web, and web/vercel.json runs wasm-pack build for pkg-web, so missing artifact should be generated at build time; no repo tracking needed.
